resources.string: Make sure that the directions in which the user can move are mentioned in the description
Make sure that items that can be picked up are added to the items list.
When describing the exits in a room, don't specify where they lead.
Make sure that all rooms, moves and items have unique ids to the game.
Generate a %1$s themed game with the following structure.
Something went wrong. Please try again.

The user issued the command: %1$s. Determine the action the user wants to take based on the following: Move: Check if it matches a valid move from %2$s. If valid, return the move ID with confirmation feedback. Pick Up: If not a move, check if the user wants to pick an item from %3$s. If yes, return the item ID with confirmation feedback. Invalid: If none of the above, analyze the room description "%4$s" and inventory %5$s and provide some creative feedback for the command. Respond with the given structure.
The user has picked up the item %1$s from the room with description %2$s. Update the description such that it does not contain the item anymore. Keep everything else the same.

Update generated game %1$s, such that for each room there is at least one move in the game that leads to that room. Also, update the moves such that for each move from room A to room B, there is a corresponding move from room B to room A in the opposite direction

Update the generated game %1$s, such that at least one move in the game has a requiredItem and add this item is in a reachable room. Also, add requiredItems and items otherwise described in the roomDescription which can be picked up are added as itemDTOs in the game structure.
